Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Truthful \Truth"ful\, a. Full of truth; veracious; reliable. -- {Truth"ful*ly}, adv. -- {Truth"ful*ness}, n. [1913 Webster]

truthful adj 1: expressing or given to expressing the truth; "a true statement"; "gave truthful testimony"; "a truthful person" [syn: {true}] [ant: {untruthful}] 2: conforming to truth; "I wouldn't have told you this if it weren't so"; "a truthful statement" [syn: {so(p)}]
